ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 01A is a 17.3 km hard circular hike in the UK, offered as a short-cut variation for C01. It combines sustained distance with varied terrain for a demanding day on the trail.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses mixed UK trail surfaces: well-maintained paths, grassy fields, potential mud and boggy sections, rocky stretches, and multiple steep ascents and descents. Navigation is generally straightforward, but signage can be sparse in remote sections; be prepared for uneven footing and occasional stream crossings.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for long daylight hours and changing weather. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers. Carry a map and compass or GPS and know how to use them. Bring ample water and high-energy snacks. Pack a lightweight rain shell and a warm layer. Stay on marked paths, respect livestock, and check for any access restrictions. Inform someone of your planned route and expected return. Mobile signal may be limited in remote stretches. Carry a whistle, first-aid kit, and a charged phone/power bank for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters as needed)
High-energy snacks and a packed lunch
Map and compass or GPS device (with routes downloaded)
Lightweight rain shell and warm layer
Emergency whistle and small first-aid kit
Mobile phone with offline maps and a power bank
Headlamp or torch (in case of delays or low light)
Light emergency blanket or space blanket
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) for the best daylight and generally milder conditions. Winter hiking is more challenging due to cold, ice, and shorter days.
